Class ClientSession

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc11.network.server.ClientSession
public class ClientSession extends Object
Represents a client session on the server

Each session is uniquely identified by a UUID token and is associated with a specific username and a VirtualClient instance, which acts as an abstraction of the communication channel (e.g., RMI or Socket).

  • Constructor Details

    • ClientSession

      public ClientSession(String username, VirtualClient virtualClient)
      Constructs a new ClientSession with the given username and virtual client

      The session token is automatically generated as a new UUID

      Parameters:
      username - the username of the client
      virtualClient - the virtual client associated with this session

  • Method Details

    • getToken

      public UUID getToken()
      Returns the session's authentication token
      Returns:
      the session UUID token

    • getUsername

      public String getUsername()
      Returns the username associated with this session
      Returns:
      the client's username

    • getVirtualClient

      public VirtualClient getVirtualClient()
      Returns the virtual client interface for communication
      Returns:
      the VirtualClient linked to this session

    • checkToken

      public boolean checkToken(UUID token)
      Verifies if the provided token matches the one assigned to this session
      Parameters:
      token - the token to verify
      Returns:
      true if the token matches, false otherwise

    • getLastPingInstant

      public Instant getLastPingInstant()
      Returns the timestamp of the last received ping from this client. This value can be used for timeout detection or connection health checks.
      Returns:
      the Instant of the last ping

    • actualizeLastPingInstant

      public void actualizeLastPingInstant()
      Updates the last ping timestamp to the current instant. Should be called whenever the server receives a ping or other signal from the client.
